headline: Warner Bros.’ Suitors All Bring Regulatory Baggage to Auction
summary: Paramount Skydance Corp., Netflix Inc. and Comcast Corp. have all made offers for all or part of the New York-based entertainment giant.  While similar regulatory concerns hang over all three bids, each also faces unique issues.  Which partner Warner Bros. picks will impact the regulatory process.

While similar regulatory concerns hang over all three bids, each also faces unique issues.  Which partner Warner Bros. picks will impact the regulatory process.

headline: Stocks to Watch Friday: Eli Lilly, Intuit, Gap, Warner Bros.
summary: ↗️ Eli Lilly (LLY): The drugmaker became the first pharmaceutical company to hit a $1 trillion market capitalization. Booming demand for its weight-loss drugs has boosted shares. ↗️ Intuit (INTU): The financial technology company's quarterly results topped forecasts, boosted by AI demand from mid-size businesses.

headline: Netflix, Comcast and Paramount Make Bids for Warner Bros.
summary: The submissions meet a Nov. 20 deadline for a first round of bids set by the board of Warner Bros. Discovery, the parent of HBO, CNN and the Warner Bros. movie and TV studios.  Comcast and Netflix are most interested in the film and TV library, which includes everything fromto Bugs Bunny.

headline: Paramount Wins European Rights to Soccer’s Champions League in $11.5 Billion Auction
summary: Paramount Skydance was awarded the rights to air most Champions League games in the U.K. and Germany, and also has U.S. media rights for the competition.

raw.headline: Paramount Wins European Rights to Soccer’s Champions League in $11.5 Billion Auction

headline: A looming price war threatens T-Mobile’s margins and subscriber gains
summary: Investing.com -- Oppenheimer downgraded T-Mobile US to Perform, warning that the wireless industry is heading into a period of slower growth and heavier competition that could pressure margins and curb the company’s long run of market share gains.

raw.headline: A looming price war threatens T-Mobile’s margins and subscriber gains

headline: Foxconn partners with OpenAI, Strategy stock falls with bitcoin
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) shares after Paramount Skydance (PSKY), Netflix (NFLX), and Comcast (CMCSA) have all submitted their bids to possibly acquire the media giant, Foxconn — which does business as Hon Hai Precision Industry (2317.TW, HNHPF) — partnering with OpenAI (OPAI.PVT), and shares of Strategy (MSTR) falling alongside bitcoin (BTC-USD). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Stock futures rebound, bitcoin sinks, WBD bids: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are rising in Friday's premarket trading after Thursday's volatile trading day tied to uncertainty over whether Federal Reserve officials will cut interest rates at their December FOMC meeting. Bitcoin (BTC-USD) sinks to $84,000 per token — an uptick after hovering just above $80,000 earlier this morning — as the crypto asset is looking at its worst trading month since 2022. Paramount Skydance (PSKY), Netflix (NFLX), and Comcast (CMCSA) have all submitted their bids to possibly acquire Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Paramount, Comcast and Netflix submit bids for Warner Bros, source says
summary: STORY: Warner Bros Discovery has received buyout bids from rivals Paramount Skydance, Comcast and Netflix.That's according to a source close to the matter on Thursday (November 20).Paramount is expected to bid for all of Warner Bros Discovery, including its cable television networks.The move is supported by the studio's controlling shareholder, Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison, who is among the world's richest men.The potential combination would strengthen Paramount's presence in movie theaters.And data shows it would give the firm a 32% share of the North American theatrical market.It could also combine its streaming service Paramount+ with HBO Max.Reuters exclusively reported the Warner Bros Discovery board rejected a mostly cash offer of nearly $24 a share for the company, which valued it at $60 billion.The board publicly announced it would consider strategic options for the studio.NBCUniversal's corporate parent, Comcast, is also interested in Warner's film and television studios and HBO.The entertainment unit has characters, including Superman and Batman, which can be used on film and at theme parks.Netflix is also interested in Warner's.The streaming giant aims to access Warner's large film library containing the likes of "Harry Potter" and "Lord of the Rings."Warner Bros Discovery didn't immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.None of the parties reportedly interested in buying the firm commented either.

raw.headline: Paramount, Comcast and Netflix submit bids for Warner Bros, source says
raw.summary: STORY: Warner Bros Discovery has received buyout bids from rivals Paramount Skydance, Comcast and Netflix.That's according to a source close to the matter on Thursday (November 20).Paramount is expected to bid for all of Warner Bros Discovery, including its cable television networks.The move is supported by the studio's controlling shareholder, Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison, who is among the world's richest men.The potential combination would strengthen Paramount's presence in movie theaters.And data shows it would give the firm a 32% share of the North American theatrical market.It could also combine its streaming service Paramount+ with HBO Max.Reuters exclusively reported the Warner Bros Discovery board rejected a mostly cash offer of nearly $24 a share for the company, which valued it at $60 billion.The board publicly announced it would consider strategic options for the studio.NBCUniversal's corporate parent, Comcast, is also interested in Warner's film and television studios and HBO.The entertainment unit has characters, including Superman and Batman, which can be used on film and at theme parks.Netflix is also interested in Warner's.The streaming giant aims to access Warner's large film library containing the likes of "Harry Potter" and "Lord of the Rings."Warner Bros Discovery didn't immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.None of the parties reportedly interested in buying the firm commented either.

headline: Tidalwave raises $22 million Series A to improve the mortgage process with AI
summary: Tidalwave, which builds agentic AI for mortgage origination, has now raised its $22 million Series A, Fortune has exclusively learned.

headline: Paramount, Comcast, Netflix submit bids for Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery recently expanded its strategic review of its business, saying it's open for a sale. First round bids came in this week.

headline: 3 Stocks Under $50 We Find Risky
summary: Stocks trading between $10 and $50 can be particularly interesting as they frequently represent businesses that have survived their early challenges. However, investors should remain vigilant as some may still have unproven business models, leaving them vulnerable to the ebbs and flows of the broader market.

raw.headline: 3 Stocks Under $50 We Find Risky
raw.summary: Stocks trading between $10 and $50 can be particularly interesting as they frequently represent businesses that have survived their early challenges. However, investors should remain vigilant as some may still have unproven business models, leaving them vulnerable to the ebbs and flows of the broader market.

headline: Paramount, Comcast and Netflix Submit Bids for Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: Paramount, Comcast and Netflix have submitted bids for Warner Bros. Discovery, owner of the storied Warner Bros. movie and television studio and HBO, according to people familiar with the matter.  The bids submitted are nonbinding, and additional rounds are expected, The Wall Street Journal previously reported.  Warner Discovery  has indicated it would like to have the process concluded by the end of the year.

raw.headline: Paramount, Comcast and Netflix Submit Bids for Warner Bros. Discovery
